lexUnit.name: cough.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: expel air from the lungs with a sudden sharp sound.

sentence.text: She coughed a little , with pain .
He went up to the two detectives and coughed delicately .
He coughed abruptly and got up .
The orchestra were coming back to their places , coughing loudly to display their discretion .
He took a deep breath , coughed yet again , and picked up one of the sheets of paper before him .
The engine coughed once then stalled .
He insinuated himself between the shells of his captors and coughed loudly .
He stopped and coughed deliberately , then took a breath .
Or you can simply sabotage the thing by coughing loudly and exploding all over the place and then of course they simply ca n't use it .
He coughed badly , he trembled and his eyes were bloodshot .
The Mercedes coughed suddenly and the chauffeur glanced at the dashboard in surprise .
Les Robinson … and Mike Ford are coughing and sneezing and facing fitness checks in the morning …
Cranston coughed and spat .
Its engine was coughing and spluttering , stopping and then picking up again .
She smoked her cigarette very slowly , trying not to cough and thinking of all the things she was going to do .
She could hear them yawning and coughing as they moved around .
He coughed as though to banish a clot of phlegm , the taste of Chaos .
She coughed all morning and her eyes were red-rimmed .
A young constable coughed with embarrassment .
Lucenzo coughed , covering his mouth and averting his head politely .
Elliott palmed blood off his face and coughed .
The steam gets to my throat and I cough .
A sob caught his throat and he coughed to mask it .
He coughed to clear his throat of the taste of the smoke .
